Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to your new favorite meal, the Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl! This nutritious and vibrant dish is not only a feast for the eyes but also a powerhouse of flavor and health benefits. Packed with lean protein from grilled chicken breast and wholesome grains from quinoa, this bowl is perfect for anyone looking to eat healthy without sacrificing taste. Fresh vegetables like bell peppers, cucumbers, and cherry tomatoes add a refreshing crunch, making every bite delightful. Plus, the zesty lemon juice and fragrant parsley elevate the entire dish, ensuring a burst of flavor with each mouthful. Whether you're meal prepping for the week or hosting a dinner for friends, this Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl is a versatile choice that caters to all. Let’s dive into this easy-to-follow recipe that will have you enjoying a gourmet meal in no time!

Ingredients

chicken breast

For a juicier chicken, consider brining it in a solution of water and salt for 30 minutes before cooking. You can also substitute chicken thighs for a more flavorful option. If you're looking for a vegetarian alternative, grilled tofu works well.

quinoa

Rinse quinoa under cold water before cooking to remove its bitter saponin coating. For added flavor, cook quinoa in vegetable or chicken broth instead of water. If you need a gluten-free substitute, use millet or rice.

bell pepper

Choose a vibrant, firm bell pepper for the best flavor and texture. You can substitute with other colors for a more colorful dish, or try roasted red peppers for a smokier taste.

cucumber

Use a seedless cucumber for a crisper texture. For extra flavor, you can marinate the cucumber in a bit of vinegar and salt before adding it to the bowl. If you want a different crunch, consider using radishes instead.

cherry tomatoes

Look for firm, bright cherry tomatoes for the best taste. To enhance their sweetness, you can roast them in the oven for 10-15 minutes before adding them to the bowl. If unavailable, grape tomatoes are a good substitute.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. You can substitute with avocado oil for a higher smoke point or flavored oils like garlic-infused olive oil to add extra depth.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is always preferable for flavor. If you don’t have fresh lemons, bottled lemon juice can be used, but it may not have the same brightness. Lime juice can also serve as a substitute for a different tang.

salt

Use kosher salt for seasoning as it dissolves easily and provides a cleaner taste. Try adding flavored salts, like garlic salt or herb salt, for additional flavor.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper provides the best flavor. If you want to spice things up, consider adding red pepper flakes or a dash of cayenne pepper.

fresh parsley

Chop the parsley just before adding to maintain its freshness and color. You can substitute with other fresh herbs like cilantro or basil for a different flavor profile.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Quinoa

    Start by rinsing 1 cup of quinoa under cold water to remove any bitterness. In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed quinoa with 2 cups of water or broth for added flavor. Bring it to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the quinoa is tender and the water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork once done.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Chicken Breast

    While the quinoa is cooking, take 1 lb of chicken breast and season it generously with salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil. This not only adds flavor but also helps create a nice sear when grilled. For beginners, try to let the chicken sit at room temperature for about 15 minutes before cooking; this helps it cook more evenly.

  • Step 3: Grill the Chicken

    Preheat your grill or grill pan over medium heat. Place the seasoned chicken breasts on the grill and cook for about 6-7 minutes on each side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C). Avoid pressing down on the chicken as this can dry it out. If you don’t have a grill, you can use a stovetop pan or bake the chicken in the oven at 375°F (190°C) for about 25-30 minutes.

  • Step 4: Rest and Slice the Chicken

    Once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for about 5 minutes. This allows the juices to redistribute, keeping the chicken moist. After resting, slice the chicken into strips for easy mixing in the bowl.

  • Step 5: Chop the Vegetables

    While the chicken is resting, chop up 1 bell pepper, 1 cucumber, and 1 cup of cherry tomatoes into bite-sized pieces. For a colorful presentation, you can use a mix of red, yellow, and green bell peppers. Remember to wash all vegetables thoroughly before chopping.

  • Step 6: Combine Ingredients

    In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, sliced grilled chicken, and chopped vegetables. Toss gently to combine, ensuring even distribution of ingredients.

  • Step 7: Dress the Bowl

    Drizzle the bowl with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice. Toss everything together to coat evenly. Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper if needed. For added flavor, consider a sprinkle of garlic powder or a pinch of cayenne.

  • Step 8: Garnish and Serve

    Finally, garnish your quinoa bowl with a handful of fresh parsley, chopped. This adds a burst of color and freshness. Serve immediately, or refrigerate for a meal prep option, as this dish tastes great cold too!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare quinoa properly?

Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine-mesh strainer to remove bitterness. Then, combine it with 2 cups of water or broth in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork before serving.

What is the best way to grill chicken?

To grill chicken breasts, first pound them to an even thickness for uniform cooking. Season with salt, pepper, and olive oil. Preheat your grill to medium heat and cook for 6-7 minutes on each side until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C). Use a meat thermometer for accuracy!

How can I tell when the chicken is cooked through?

The best way to check if chicken is cooked is to use a meat thermometer. Insert it into the thickest part of the breast; it should read 165°F (75°C). If you don’t have a thermometer, cut into the chicken, and it should be white with no pink juices.

What should I do if I accidentally overcook the chicken?

If your chicken is overcooked and dry, try slicing it thinly and mixing it into your quinoa bowl with extra dressing or sauce to add moisture. You can also serve it with a yogurt-based sauce to help balance the dryness.

How do I safely handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw chicken. Use separate cutting boards for raw meat and vegetables to avoid cross-contamination. Cook chicken to the proper temperature to kill harmful bacteria.

How do I chop vegetables efficiently?

To chop vegetables, start by washing them thoroughly. For bell peppers, cut off the top and bottom, remove the seeds, and then slice into strips. For cucumbers, slice off the ends and cut into rounds or half-moons. Practice using a claw grip with your fingers to keep them safe while cutting.

Can I substitute any ingredients in this recipe?

Yes! You can use any vegetables you have on hand, such as zucchini or carrots. You can also replace chicken with tofu or chickpeas for a vegetarian option, and use lime juice instead of lemon for a different flavor.

What is the purpose of letting the chicken rest after cooking?

Letting chicken rest for a few minutes after cooking allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, making it juicier and more flavorful when you slice into it.

How can I make my quinoa bowl more flavorful?

You can add spices or herbs to the quinoa while it cooks, use flavored broth instead of water, or toss in additional ingredients like nuts, seeds, or a sprinkle of feta cheese for extra taste.

What are some good garnishes for my quinoa bowl?

Fresh herbs, like parsley or cilantro, avocado slices, nuts, seeds, or crumbled cheese can enhance the look and flavor of your quinoa bowl!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free and can be made dairy-free by omitting any cheese. For a vegetarian option, substitute the chicken with grilled tofu or chickpeas. To make it vegan, ensure all dressings are free from animal products and replace honey with agave syrup if used. This bowl is packed with protein and fiber, making it suitable for high-protein, low-carb, and Mediterranean diets.

Pairings

This Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl pairs wonderfully with a crisp Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied Pinot Grigio, which will complement the fresh vegetables and the lemon juice. For a non-alcoholic option, try sparkling water with a splash of lemon or cucumber-infused lemonade. If you prefer a heartier pairing, consider serving with grilled asparagus or a side of garlic bread.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the quinoa bowl in individual bowls or on a large platter for sharing. Add a sprinkle of feta cheese or crumbled goat cheese on top for creaminess and added flavor. For added crunch, you could include toasted nuts such as almonds or walnuts. A drizzle of balsamic reduction over the top can enhance the dish visually and flavor-wise. Serve with a lemon wedge on the side for an extra burst of citrus at the table.

#

Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl

30 min
$15
450 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinGluten FreeLow Carb

Cuisine:

AmericanMediterranean

Course:

Main CourseHealthy Meal

Tags:

HealthyEasyQuickGrilled

Description

A nutritious and delicious bowl packed with grilled chicken, fluffy quinoa, and fresh veggies, drizzled with a light dressing.

Ingredients

  • chicken breast: 1 lb
  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • bell pepper: 1
  • cucumber: 1
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup
  • olive oil: 2 tbsp
  • lemon juice: 2 tbsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • fresh parsley: a handful
